1.str2: Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
Timothy, a Christian of Lystra, helper of Paul. From time and theos; dear to God; Timotheus, a Christian.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

Philippi, a great city of the Roman province Macedonia. Plural of Philippos; Philippi, a place in Macedonia.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
From epi and skopos; a superintendent, i.e. Christian officer in genitive case charge of a church.
Probably from an obsolete diako; an attendant, i.e. a waiter; specially, a Christian teacher and pastor.

Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.

20.str2: To be ashamed, be put to shame. From aischos; to feel shame.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
From pas and a derivative of rheo; all out-spokenness, i.e. Frankness, bluntness, publicity; by implication, assurance.
And, even, also, namely.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Always, at all times, ever. From pas and hote; every when, i.e. At all times.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

20.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
20.str2: (a) I enlarge, lengthen, (b) I increase, magnify, extol. From megas; to make great, i.e. Increase or extol.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

20.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
20.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.

21.str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
Gain, advantage, profit. Of uncertain affinity; gain.

22.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
Probably from the base of harpazo; fruit, literally or figuratively.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

22.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
22.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

22.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
22.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

22.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
22.str2: To choose, prefer. Probably akin to airo; to take for oneself, i.e. To prefer.

22.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
22.str2: To make known, declare, know, discover. From a derivative of ginosko; to make known; subjectively, to know.

23.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
23.str2: From sun and echo; to hold together, i.e. To compress or arrest; figuratively, to compel, perplex, afflict, preoccupy.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.
To unloose, unloose for departure, depart, return. From ana and luo; to break up, i.e. Depart.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Stronger, more excellent. Neuter of an alternate form of kreitton; better, i.e. Greater advantage.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

24.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Necessary, essential, intimate, right, proper. From anagke; necessary; by implication, close.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

24.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.

25.str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

25.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
25.str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.

25.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
25.str2: To remain by, abide with; met: I persevere in. From para and meno; to stay near, i.e. Remain.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

25.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
25.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

26.str2: My, mine. From the oblique cases of ego; my.

To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

26.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
26.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.

Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

27.str2: To live the life of a citizen, live. Middle voice of a derivative of polites; to behave as a citizen.

From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.

And, even, also, namely.

One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
